title: Migrate to ropsten failed
body:
- [ ] I've [opened a support ticket](https://trufflesuite.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) before filing this issue.

---------------------------

## Issue

I have attempted to migrate my project to the ropsten network and in doing so, I get an error stating that I have an insufficient balance even though ganache-cli illustates that all accounts have a balance of 1000ETH. I then proceed to check that it is indeed the account being made use of by updating the truffle-config.js file only the get the same error. Any idea why this may be?

## Steps to Reproduce

Step.1 - Install and configure the petshop box.
Step.2 - Download, install and configure HDWalletProvider
Step.3 - Migrate to ropsten network

## Expected Behavior

Expected the migration to complete successfully.

## Actual Results

![ksnip_20220330-125634](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/88763657/160805106-5edaa1aa-eea2-47ba-b44a-e540335188c6.png)
![ksnip_20220330-130355](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/88763657/160806506-afc78ec3-8fdc-490a-b9fb-89177a111705.png)




## Environment

* Operating System: Ubuntu 20.04
* Ethereum client: 
* Truffle version (`truffle version`): v5.5.6
* node version (`node --version`): v16.14.2
* npm version (`npm --version`): 8.5.0

Hi, @userjuan1 thank you for opening the issue. 
To look into this, can you help to provide us with access to your project repo or a minimal project sample, as well as the CLI commands you used to reproduce the error?

Thank you for sharing those @userjuan1.
It's preferable to have access to the project repo to confirm, but from looking at the information you provided so far I believe you're trying to migrate to the live Ropsten network using an account from the local ganache-UI. 
You may be following our pet shop tutorial (we are in the progress to update it).

If your intention is to actually migrate and deploy on ropsten, then you will need an account with funds on the public blockchain.

If you just want to use ganache for development purposes and test migration, then I would recommend checking out [ganache 7](https://trufflesuite.com/blog/introducing-ganache-7/#c-using-ganache-7-in-the-browser). You can fork the ropsten network by `ganache --fork.network ropsten` and then on a separate terminal window run `truffle migrate`. Let us know how that works out and if we can assist you further.
Thank so much for your reply. I literally thought I was on Mars, but fortunately you have given me some advice.

Hello again,

Thank you so much for you advice. Please see below output of the advice you have given me :

This is the command line output of : _ganache -h 127.0.0.1 -p 7545 --fork.network ropsten_

Apart from that I have updated my .secrets file as added good measure with the relevant priv key and/or mnemonic although when I issue truffle migrate, it just hangs, see below output:

Compiling your contracts...
===========================
> Everything is up to date, there is nothing to compile.
WARNING: Ganache forking only supports EIP-1193-compliant providers. Legacy support for send is currently enabled, but will be removed in a future version _without_ a breaking change. To remove this warning, switch to an EIP-1193 provider. This error is probably caused by an old version of Web3's HttpProvider (or ganache < v7)


That's all I see. Please help!

Can you help to inform me which one is your intention? To deploy on ropsten or just test locally on ganache? If you're wanting to test locally. No provider is needed as ganache is doing it for you already. Also the message 
```
Everything is up to date, there is nothing to compile.
WARNING: Ganache forking only supports EIP-1193-compliant providers. Legacy support for send is currently enabled but will be removed in a future version without a breaking change. To remove this warning, switch to an EIP-1193 provider. This error is probably caused by an old version of Web3's HttpProvider (or ganache < v7)
``` 
indicated that this has been compiled already. You should have a build directory now.
I'd like to deploy on ropsten and then to respond to you latest message, is my project has always been up-to-date to compiled, so the build dir is not new. Please could you help me deploy to ropsten?
Alternatively, what would be the best way to get my project migrated to a live blockchain?

To deploy to ropsten, you will need an account with ropsten ETH instead of the ganache account. ( please note that ganache is a local blockchain environment and its eths are only useful for the local development and testing purpose.

Good day,

Thank you so much for your help. Please see below : 

![ksnip_20220401-103234](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/88763657/161216705-34a55548-db39-4398-b63d-019f12b935bb.png)

![ksnip_20220401-103145](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/88763657/161216748-e124cc8d-75a4-48ca-b034-c349e6c4aa59.png)


All checks out okay. Couldn't be more thankful for your help.
Great to hear @userjuan1. Closing this issue now.
